newsitem.title: USA: IMM currency futures end quiet trading mixed.
newsitem.headline: IMM currency futures end quiet trading mixed.

text.p: Aug 27 - IMM currency futures ended quiet trade mixed. Goldman Sachs in report said it expects Can dollar to rise to C$1.33 per U.S. dollar likely by yearend. Earlier, traders said 674 total Sept Can dollars were bought at $0.7312, $0.7322. Resistance held at $0.7325. Some said a strong Tankan report on Weds could buoy yen. Redbook retail sales rose 0.9 pct, had no effect. -Derivatives Desk(312)408-8750/E-mail:derivatives@reuters.com
"We hit stops at 1.3680 with a 1.3650 target but we only got to 1.3675, and then Goldman came out with its recommendation," said another floor broker.
Late in the session, Goldman Sachs and Co Inc said in a weekly research report that it expects the Canadian dollar to rise to C$1.33 per U.S. dollar likely by year end.
By midday in September marks, traders said one fund had sold a total of between 1,000 and 2,000 contracts piecemeal, starting at about $0.6783 to the day's low at $0.6767.
The yen popped up late to the day's peak, but daily volume was scanty at best, estimated at about 8,200 contracts.
